intro: Navarretia willamettensis, commonly known as the Willamette Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as prairies and meadows. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Navarretia willamettensis is known for its ephemeral blooming cycle, with flowers appearing briefly before the plant goes dormant.
